thread.title: Autorama to re-create 'Dukes of Hazzard' jump
thread.title_full: Autorama to re-create 'Dukes of Hazzard' jump

author: Detroit Free Press
title: Autorama to re-create 'Dukes of Hazzard' jump
text:
Autorama to re-create 'Dukes of Hazzard' jump Hot rod show to launch with spectacular stunt in downtown Detroit. Post to Facebook Autorama to re-create 'Dukes of Hazzard' jump Hot rod show to launch with spectacular stunt in downtown Detroit.  //on.freep.com/2lths06   Join the Conversation To   Autorama to re-create 'Dukes of Hazzard' jump Frank Witsil , Detroit Free Press 10:50 p.m. ET Feb. 21, 2017 Catherine "Daisy" Bach, Tom "Luke" Wopat, John "Bo" Schneider and The General Lee, on The Dukes of Hazzard. (Photo: PRNewsFoto) 1 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Autorama organizers are planning a spectacular car stunt to launch — so to speak — the hot rod show. 
The weekend show, which begins Friday at Cobo Center, aims to re-create a scene from “The Dukes of Hazzard” — a popular TV series from the early '80s and later a movie. A replica of the General Lee, the name of the car that the main characters in the show drove, is to drive off a 15-foot high ramp on Atwater near the convention hall and fly through the air for 30 feet or more. 
From 2016: 1st Aussie car to participate in Detroit Autorama 
"It's going to be an unbelievable stunt," said Pete Toundas, the president and owner of the group that puts on Autorama. "It's going to simulate the scenes going back to 'The Dukes of Hazzard' days. This will be a special stunt car with a lot of safety features built into it. It will look just like the General Lee." 
Toundas expects the stunt — which is scheduled for 11:45 a.m. and open to the public — to draw a crowd just before Autorama's doors open at noon. 
Toundas said the show will feature the General Lee because the car — an orange, 1969 Dodge Charger with the number 01 on its doors and a Confederate flag on its roof — has long been associated with Autorama, now in its 65th year. Two stars from the TV show — Catherine Bach, who played Daisy, and Tom Wopat, who played Luke — are scheduled to appear from 1-5 p.m. on Friday and Saturday. 
The General Lee will be appearing at Autorama this weekend. (Photo: Autorama) 
The Confederate flag, which will be on the stunt car, became the subject of national debate two years ago after the death of nine people in a Charleston, S.C., church. Warner Bros. later said it would stop licensing General Lee toy cars and models that included the flag. And golfer Bubba Watson, who bought the original car featured in the show, had the flag painted over. 
The TV show ran from 1979 to 1985. Stunts often ended in crashes, costing the show hundreds of orange Chargers. 
See-through barriers will be put up along Atwater to protect spectators. Depending on what happens to the General Lee after the stunt, it may go on display at the show. 
Contact Frank Witsil: 313-222-5022 or fwitsil@freepress.com. If you go 
When: 11:45 a.m. Friday 
Where: Atwater, near Cobo Center in Detroit 
Cost: It will be free to see the stunt, which is open to the public. Tickets to the show, which starts at noon, are $20 for adults, $7 for children ages 6-12, free for kids 5 and younger. Discount tickets are available at O'Reilly Auto Parts. 
The General Lee will be appearing at Autorama this weekend. (Photo: Autorama)
